snippet: A project called Downtown Crossing calls for constructing streets, sidewalks and buildings above the Oak Street Connector, which severed a neighborhood from the heart of downtown.
abstract: Highway that severed a neighborhood from the heart of the downtown of New Haven, Conn, was built as part of an urban renewal project in the 1950s, but is now considered a mistake; it will be corrected as part of a $135 million redevelopment plan that has been years in the making.
lead_paragraph: A project called Downtown Crossing calls for constructing streets, sidewalks and buildings above the Oak Street Connector, which severed a neighborhood from the heart of downtown.

headline.seo: A Plan in New Haven to Right a Highway’s Wrong
headline.main: A Plan in New Haven to Right a Highway’s Wrong
